Name: Surrogate Modelling
Summary: Mathematical approximation model of full parent model useful when it is expensive to simulate the parent model
Adv: Significantly reduce simulation time of compelx models
Disadv: Needs and training not robust to discontinuities

Name: Combinatorial optimisation
Summary: Discrete type of optimisation find an optimum set from a finite set of objects e.g. travelling sales man problem
Outputs: Optimum set of system element types
Disadv: Can be NP complete long simulation time

Name: Constrained Combinatorial optimisation
Summary: Discrete type of optimisation find an optimum set from a finite set of objects e.g. travelling sales man problem, with constraints
Inputs: Finite Set of Element Variants;Design Constraints
Outputs: Optimum set of system element types
Disadv: Can be NP complete long simulation time
Solves: Selection of designs;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Agentbased otpimsiation
Summary: Optimisation scheme using multiple agents that follow their own optimisation method to find an optimal point
Adv: Increase chances of finding global optimum not just a local one

Name: Constrained Agentbased otpimsiation
Summary: Optimisation scheme using multiple agents that follow their own optimisation method to find an optimal point, with constraints
Adv: Increase chances of finding global optimum not just a local one
Solves: Selection of designs;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Gradient based optimisation
Summary: can be type of agent optimisation follows direction of steepest descent to find minimum
Disadv: If not agent based can get trapped in local minimum

Name: Constrained Gradient based optimisation
Summary: can be type of agent optimisation follows direction of steepest descent to find minimum, with constraints
Disadv: If not agent based can get trapped in local minimum
Solves: Selection of designs;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Genetic Optimisation
Summary: type of agent optimisation uses repeated cross over and mutation between a population of individual solutions to find minimum

Name: Constrained Genetic Optimisation
Summary: type of agent optimisation uses repeated cross over and mutation between a population of individual solutions to find minimum, with constraints
Solves: Selection of designs;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Particle swarm optimisation
Summary: type of agent optimisation

Name: Constrained Particle swarm optimisation
Summary: type of agent optimisation, with constraints
Solves: Selection of designs;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Simulated annealing optimisation
Summary: type of agent optimisation

Name: Constrained Simulated annealing optimisation
Summary: type of agent optimisation, with constraints
Solves: Selection of designs;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Interactive Optimisation
Summary: A human expert is able to make inputs to the optimisation process either by changing search directions or parameters etc
Outputs: Globally Optimal Design Parameters;Selection of unmeasured aspects
Adv: Can better be fused with expert intuition

Name: Constrained Interactive Optimisation
Summary: A human expert is able to make inputs to the optimisation process either by changing search directions or parameters etc, with constraints
Outputs: Globally Optimal Design Parameters;Selection of unmeasured aspects
Adv: Can better be fused with expert intuition
Solves: Selection of designs;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: OSMoSE Ontology
Summary: Ontology describing space systems could be used to help generate system architectures consistent with industry

Name: Rule based design generation
Summary: Discrete rules for if such and such as aspect of the organisation or requirements are present then include such and such an element in the design

Name: Design of experiments
Summary: Statistical process for identifying configuration of tests with the aim of identifying what key factors influence outputs  what setting should they be in acceptable outputs main interactions in the process how to minimise variation in the outputs
Disadv: Need to run more simulations to identify sensitivities
Solves: Design Space Coverage;Identification of what aspects to vary and at what level

Name: Evolutionary generative design
Summary: IDK
Solves: Synthesis of new alternatives;Synthesis of NOVEL alternatives

Name: Constrained Evolutionary generative design
Summary: IDK, with constraints
Solves: Synthesis of new alternatives;Synthesis of NOVEL alternatives;Application of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Procedural generative design rule based
Summary: IDK

Name: Machine Learning
Summary: IDK

Name: Deep Reinforcement learning for design concept generation assistant
Summary: Machine learning Selected a component selection from a database action then evaluate this e.g. by using a parametric model. Calculate a reword for this then use this to learn on a neural network the actionreward mapping
Adv: Identify optimum component selection generally faster than combinatorial approaches
Disadv: Must first train Neural net to learn rewardaction mapping limited to component database scope

Name: Parametric Variability SysML Stereotypes
Summary: New SysML stereotypes for describing the parameter level variation of design variables
Adv: Enables parameter level varaibility description in SysML models

Name: Objective SysML Stereotypes
Summary: New SysML stereotypes for describing the objectives related to the model
Adv: Enables a simple selection method of designs - better value of objectives the better the design
Disadv: Can become ambiguous with many confolicting objectives

Name: Design constraint and dependant variable SysML Stereotypes
Summary: New SysML stereotypes for describing dependant variables and constraints related to them to identify compliant/feasible and infeasible/noncompliant designs
Adv: Enables description of where the feasible desing region is
Disadv: difficult to describe more complex constriants than a parameter being within a certain range
Solves: Description of constraints on feasible designs

Name: Swarm intelligence and multi-agent societies
Summary: Commonly used to model social or collective behaviours, they are capable of autonomous action using their individual priorities. Essentially a set of unsophisticated individuals interact local with their environment and cause a system or global level functional pattern - emergent behaviour
Adv: Regular design evaluation and improvement Multiple solutions Optimisation Disruptive innovation from 45
Disadv: heavy computation requirement, Progress slows down after achieving near optima solutions from 45
Solves: Synthesis of new alternatives;Synthesis of NOVEL alternatives
